meanings.definition: A sharp sound made by striking the palms of the hands together.
meanings.sent1: The children's handclap echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The audience erupted in applause, their handclaps filling the theater.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the handclap signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent4: The handclap of thunder startled the hikers in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic handclap added energy to the music performance.

meanings.definition: To strike the palms of the hands together to make a sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: She would handclap along with the music at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The students handclapped in unison to show their appreciation.
meanings.sent3: The chef would handclap to the beat while cooking in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The protesters handclapped to make their voices heard in the rally.
meanings.sent5: He would handclap enthusiastically to cheer on his teammates.
